title: Volvo XC90 B5 review: mild hybrid technology makes this seven-seater hard to beat
text:
Mild hybrid. If you hadn’t heard the term already, you have now. And you can expect to hear an awful lot more of it in the coming years, as mild hybridisation – the art of tacking on a very small electric motor, smaller than that of a traditional hybrid, and an extra battery, to aid the consumption and reduce the emissions of an internal combustion engine – gains momentum.

Volvo is the latest to introduce mild hybrid engines to its range; in fact, it has added two (you can tell them apart as they’re badged with a ‘B’). The 194bhp B4 is only available in the XC60, while the 232bhp B5 can be had in the XC90 too. Both are based on its 2.0-litre four-cylinder diesel engines, though petrol versions...
